item.title: 经华盛顿特区批准，NFL 指挥官赢得 37 亿美元体育场交易
item.description: 随着市政府官员批准了一项耗资约 37 亿美元的计划，在 RFK 体育场的场地上建造一座新的体育馆和综合开发项目，华盛顿司令队在阔别三十年后将正式重返哥伦比亚特区。【原文：The Washington Commanders are officially returning to the District of Columbia after a three-decade hiatus, with city officials approving a roughly $3.7 billion plan for a new stadium and mixed-use development on the grounds of RFK Stadium.】

item.title: 米莱赌局褪色，阿根廷经纪人损失惨重
item.description: 当地资产的下滑、挥之不去的资本管制以及仍被外国投资者避之不及的经济，使阿根廷资本市场繁荣的希望破灭，这对那些在哈维尔-米莱总统两年前上任后押注阿根廷经济复苏的小型经纪公司造成了压力。【原文：A slide in local assets, lingering capital controls and an economy still shunned by foreign investors are deflating hopes for a boom in Argentina’s capital markets, weighing on small brokerage firms that had bet on a revival after President Javier Milei took office two years ago.】

item.title: Uber 投资 Flytrex，重回无人机送货领域
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc. 将与 Flytrex Inc. 合作试用无人机送餐，这标志着这家共享出行巨头重返物流实验领域。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. will trial food deliveries by drone with Flytrex Inc., marking the rideshare giant’s return to experiments with logistics.】

item.title: Waymo 和 Via 将在亚利桑那州提供自动驾驶公共交通服务
item.description: 上周五上市的公共交通软件制造商 Via Transportation Inc. 将与 Waymo 合作，于今年秋天在亚利桑那州推出自动驾驶共享乘车服务。【原文：Via Transportation Inc., the public transit software maker that went public last Friday, will partner with Waymo to launch autonomous shared rides in Arizona this fall.】

item.title: 乌克兰电信公司在纳斯达克的首次亮相得益于战时的应变能力
item.description: 在纳斯达克的开市仪式上，总理和祈祷者的身影并不多见。不过，乌克兰公司在美国证券交易所上市也同样罕见。【原文：It’s not often that the Nasdaq’s market-opening ceremony includes a prime minister and a call to prayer. Then again, it’s just as rare for a Ukrainian company to list on an American stock exchange.】

item.title: 印度可能终于准备好进入原子时代
item.description:
经过多年的推诿，立法者可能会让投资者更容易将赌注押在核电上。【原文：

After years of prevarication, lawmakers might be about to make it easier for investors to bet on nuclear power. 

】

item.title: 阿波罗利用复杂债务工具向保险公司寻求 100 亿美元贷款
item.description: 知情人士透露，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is set to use a rare structure to raise $10 billion from insurers, people with knowledge of the matter said, in the latest illustration of the increasing ties between private capital and annuity providers.】

item.title: 波兰工资增长放缓为 10 月降息创造条件
item.description: 波兰 8 月份的工资增长速度是 2021 年以来最慢的，低于分析师的预期，并增加了下个月降息的可能性。【原文：Wages in Poland grew their slowest since 2021 in August, coming in below analysts’ expectations and raising the prospect of an interest rate cut next month.】

item.title: 据说通用电气医疗集团正在探索出售中国业务的股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，通用电气医疗保健技术公司（GE Healthcare Technologies Inc.【原文：GE Healthcare Technologies Inc. is exploring options including the sale of a stake in its China unit, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 让我们不断滚动的 TikTok 算法仍是交易的核心
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，亚历山德拉-莱文（Alexandra Levine）将评估中美之间为让美国人继续使用 TikTok 而可能达成的协议中的关键问题。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Alexandra Levine assesses the key issues in a potential deal between the US and China to keep TikTok available to Americans.】

item.title: 美联储仍是鲍威尔的天下，而非特朗普的天下，因为米澜得不到支持
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美联储的新政策展望。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the Fed’s new policy outlook. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 洛杉矶港集装箱潮结束
item.description: 美国最繁忙的集装箱门户 8 月份的贸易量接近 7 月份创下的历史纪录，但由于唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税政策和贸易战的不确定性继续增加，本月的贸易量将下降 10%。【原文：August trade volumes at the busiest container gateway in the US held near an all-time record set in July but are set to drop by 10% this month as President Donald Trump’s tariffs bite and trade war uncertainty continues to mount.】

item.title: 英国央行将利率维持在 4%，对未来降息保持谨慎态度
item.description: 英国央行将利率维持在 4% 的水平，并对今年晚些时候进一步下调利率的前景表示怀疑，因为人们对通胀回升的担忧与日俱增。【原文：The Bank of England held interest rates at 4% and left the prospect of more cuts later this year in doubt after growing concerns over a resurgence in inflation.】

item.title: 英国央行放缓量化宽松步伐至 700 亿英镑，限制长期债券销售
item.description: 英格兰银行表示，它将放慢减持政府债券的步伐，并偏向于出售期限较长的债券，以帮助限制量化紧缩政策对金边债券市场的影响。【原文：The Bank of England said it will slow the pace at which it is reducing its government bond holdings and skew sales away from longer-dated debt to help limit the impact of quantitative tightening on the gilt market.】

item.title: 英伟达向英特尔投资 50 亿美元，计划共同设计芯片
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）同意向英特尔公司投资 50 亿美元，并表示双方将共同开发用于个人电脑和数据中心的芯片。【原文：Nvidia Corp. agreed to invest $5 billion in Intel Corp. and said the two will co-develop chips for PCs and data centers, a surprise move to help prop up an ailing archrival.】

item.title: 埃克森首席执行官警告欧盟气候和人权法 "伤筋动骨
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）呼吁欧洲领导人废除一项新的气候和人权法律，该法律将对企业处以罚款，并有可能成为美欧贸易谈判的热点。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. called for European leaders to repeal a new climate and human rights law that would fine corporations and is threatening to become a flashpoint in US-EU trade negotiations.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的道路可能对股票和债券价格有利
item.description:
在重新评估了市场对美联储减息的反应后，市场今天攀升。【原文：

Markets are climbing today after reassessing their response to the Fed cut.

】

item.title: 印度养老金监管机构着眼于促进基础设施投资
item.description: 在印度政府为公路和港口等项目融资债券推出信用增级计划后，印度养老金监管机构对促进更多投资该国蓬勃发展的基础设施领域持开放态度。【原文：India’s pension regulator is open to facilitating more investment in the country’s booming infrastructure space after the government launched a credit enhancement program for bonds that finance projects like roads and ports.】

item.title: 中国展示人工智能芯片实力引发 2400 亿美元涨势
item.description: 从华为技术有限公司到阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司，中国最大的科技公司本月竞相吹嘘其最新的人工智能芯片进展。这些公司在公众面前日益张扬的姿态赢得了投资者的关注，并引发了价值 2400 亿美元的股市大涨。【原文：From Huawei Technologies Co. to Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., China’s biggest tech firms have vied with each other this month to tout their latest AI chip advancements. Their growing public swagger is gaining investors’ attention, igniting a $240 billion stock market rally.】

item.title: Inter Ikea 任命扬科夫斯基接替 Abrahamsson Ring 担任首席执行官
item.description: 瑞典家具品牌宜家（IKEA）的全球特许经营商英特宜家集团（Inter Ikea Group）表示，雅各布-扬科夫斯基（Jakub Jankowski）将于 1 月 1 日接任首席执行官一职，结束公司老将乔恩-亚伯拉罕松-林（Jon Abrahamsson Ring）长达五年的统治。【原文：Inter Ikea Group, the global franchiser of the Swedish furniture brand IKEA, said Jakub Jankowski will take over as chief executive officer on Jan. 1, ending the five-year reign of company veteran Jon Abrahamsson Ring.】

item.title: 收购 DoorDash 后，Deliveroo 首席执行官 Will Shu 将卸任
item.description: Deliveroo Plc 表示，首席执行官 Will Shu 将在 DoorDash 公司完成收购后从他创办的公司离职。该交易预计将于 10 月 2 日完成。【原文：Deliveroo Plc said Chief Executive Officer Will Shu will step down from the company he founded after DoorDash Inc. completes its acquisition. The deal is expected to close on October 2.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称通胀目标超调风险不大
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，即使最新预测继续显示物价涨幅将在一段时间内低于 2%，但通胀目标未达标的风险并不高。【原文：European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said the risk of undershooting the inflation goal isn’t elevated, even if the latest projections continue to show a period of price gains falling below 2%.】

item.title: 台湾在新武器交易中重点关注 Anduril 无人机和软件
item.description: 台湾将从六家美国和加拿大公司开发或购买武器，这些公司加深了台湾在自主系统方面的投资，其中包括 Anduril Industries 公司的 DIVE-LD 水下无人机。【原文：Taiwan will develop or buy weapons from six US and Canadian companies that deepen its investment in autonomous systems, including Anduril Industries Inc.’s DIVE-LD underwater drone.】

item.title: 德国央行称德国本季度可能恢复增长
item.description: 据德国联邦银行（Bundesbank）称，在工业需求的推动下，德国经济可能在第三季度恢复增长。【原文：The German economy probably returned to growth in the third quarter, bolstered by industrial demand, according to the Bundesbank.】

item.title: 德意志银行首席财务官称，规则趋弱使美国银行更具优势
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）警告说，美国金融监管的全面倒退将给这家德国贷款机构的海外竞争对手带来优势。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG warned that a broad rollback of financial regulations in the US will give the German lender’s overseas competitor an edge.】

item.title: 老道氏理论从联邦快递财报中发现股市反弹线索
item.description: 联邦快递公司（FedEx Corp. ）周四公布的财报可能会提供一些线索，说明股市在创下最新纪录后还能涨多少，至少根据被称为 "道氏理论"（Dow Theory）的股市理论是这样。【原文：FedEx Corp.’s earnings on Thursday are likely to provide some clues about how much further the stock market rally can go after its latest record run, at least according to the stock market thesis called the Dow Theory.】

item.title: Pets at Home 发布最新盈利警告，首席执行官离职，业绩下滑
item.description: Pets at Home Group Plc 在不到两个月的时间内第二次下调利润预期，并称其首席执行官已经离职，其股价跌幅创下历史之最。【原文：Pets at Home Group Plc’s shares tumbled the most on record after it lowered its profit forecast for the second time in less than two months and said its chief executive officer has left the company.】

item.title: 意大利私人信贷热潮吸引资产管理公司 Nextalia
item.description: 意大利资产管理公司 Nextalia 正在推出一项私人信贷战略，以满足该国日益增长的传统银行业务以外的融资需求。【原文：Italian asset management firm Nextalia is launching a private credit strategy to tap into the country’s increasing demand for financing outside of traditional banking.】

item.title: 关税恐慌之后，瑞士八月对美黄金出口大幅下滑
item.description: 欧洲主要精炼中心瑞士对美国的金条出口在 8 月份急剧下降，因为一项令人震惊的裁决暂时对金条征收关税。【原文：Bullion exports to the US from Europe’s main refining hub in Switzerland plummeted in August, after a shock ruling that temporarily imposed tariffs on gold bars.】

item.title: 苹果提价让 iPhone 质疑者有理由保持乐观
item.description: 苹果公司的最新款 iPhone 手机并没有令人眼花缭乱的新功能，但投资者开始看淡这一点，他们认为设备的价格上涨是买入该公司股票的理由。【原文：Apple Inc.’s latest iPhones didn’t dazzle with new features, but investors are starting to look past that, seeing higher price tags on the devices as a reason to buy the company’s shares.】
